text:
The easiest way to become rich? 
Don't buy things to impress broke people.

A ₹1,000 T-shirt vs. a ₹10,000 one - same purpose.
A used car vs. a luxury car—both take you from A to B.
An old iPhone vs. the latest model - same apps, same texts.

The difference?
One makes you look rich.
The other actually makes you rich.

We spend so much trying to impress people who don’t care.
True wealth is when you stop chasing validation.
Build assets, not liabilities.

A Congress minister once said, 'When you are getting raped, lie down and enjoy it.'

No arrest. No nationwide outrage.
No calls for justice.

But today, people are demanding Ranveer’s arrest for an incest joke on a comedy show.

So let’s get this straight:
A politician normalizing rape? Silence.

A comedian making an inappropriate joke? Immediate outrage.

Don't think that I have sympathy for Ranveer, I have the issue with prioritization of problems.

As women, we are told to stay silent when we are molested by family members.

‘Don’t ruin the family name.’

‘Who will marry you if this comes out?’

‘It happens in every house. Adjust.’

We are expected to endure domestic abuse because:

‘Shaadi mein compromise toh karna padta hai.’

‘Ghar ki baat ghar mein rakhni chahiye.’

‘Aurat hi ghar banati hai.’

But when a joke is made, suddenly, morality awakens.

Suddenly, people care about what is offensive and inappropriate.
Where was this outrage when:

Marital rape is still not criminalized?

Domestic violence cases are dismissed as 'ghar ka maamla'?

Women reporting harassment are shamed instead of believed?

This isn’t about defending a joke. This is about society’s hypocrisy - where outrage is selective, and power decides whose voice matters.

If we put even half the energy we do into canceling celebrities into holding real abusers accountable, maybe this country would be safer for women.

But no, it's easier to be offended by words than by the system that allows real violence to continue.

If words hurt you more than actions, maybe it’s time to rethink what really needs to change.

My mother used my LinkedIn against me

Mum - When are you planning to get married?
Me - Idk.

Mum - Do you have a boyfriend or something? let me know at least.
Me - No.

Mum - Then who will you marry?
Me - The guy that you'll get me.

Mum - Why will we search? Do it yourself.
Me - When I had a bf, you said it's a bad thing and you'll find someone for me. No love marriages

Mum - How will I search? You have 90k+ followers on LinkedIn. 30k+ connections.

'Ek real connection bhi bana le'

I am sorry I had to say the last part in Hindi because it hurts more in that.

I see the same job openings reposted by the employer again and again for the past 3 months.

I don't understand what is the issue here.
Clearly, there is no intention of hiring.

Is it just to collect data?

Is it to look that they're growing?

Is it a tactic to keep the job market hopeful while they have no real openings?

Whatever the reason, it’s unfair to job seekers who invest time and effort into applying.

If you're a recruiter or a hiring manager, please only post roles that you genuinely intend to fill.

People's careers aren't a marketing strategy.

The Best ROI You’ll Ever Get-

We often think of ROI in terms of money, growth, or success. But the highest return on investment? It’s in people.

- A kind word today might be remembered years later.

- A supportive leader can change someone’s entire career.

- A simple 'How are you?' can mean the world to someone struggling.

The best investments aren’t in stocks or assets - they’re in kindness, patience, and the people around us. And the best part? The returns come in the form of trust, gratitude, and a lasting impact.

Who’s someone that invested in you with their kindness? Let’s take a moment to appreciate them.

Reminder -

Whatever happened today, you did your best.

You made it through the day, take a deep breath.

Take a deep breath, relax your shoulders, and let it go!

You deserve the rest :)

Tomorrow's a new day, a new opportunity!

I just want to take a moment to remind you of something beautiful -

You are doing so much better than you think. 
You are growing in ways you don’t even realize. 
You are loved more than you can imagine. 

Life isn’t about having it all figured out. It’s about the little things -

The way your eyes light up when you talk about something you love. 

The way you make others smile without even trying. 

The way you keep going, even on the hard days. 

And oh, how wonderful it is that you exist! 

If today feels heavy, I hope you find a moment of peace. 

If today feels lonely, I hope you remember how many hearts you’ve touched. 

If today feels like ‘just another day,’ I hope you notice the tiny, beautiful moments - the sun on your skin, the laughter of a stranger, the quiet warmth of being alive. 

You are not here to be perfect. You are here to be *you* - and that is already enough. 

So take a deep breath, give yourself a little grace, and know that this world is so much brighter because you are in it. 

Sending you a big, warm hug. Keep shining.

Went out today.

Saw a man selling heart-shaped balloons.

He asked me to buy it, 'Lelo didi boyfriend ko de dena' (jale pe namak lagate hue)

Me - 'Nahi hai boyfriend'

He said - 'Apne liye lelo, Valentine's Day hai aaj, pyaar ka dinn, khud ke liye lelo'

So, I have 2 heart balloons now.

*Self-love ka kitna pressure hai*

Bhai, I don't want to buy myself flowers or chocolates.

I don't want to be independent, I am a weak independent woman, bass hone hi waali hu dependent.

So, selling balloon for INR 9, please let me know in case you want to buy.

This INR 9 balloon can't guarantee you a 45 LPA job though.

My only Valentine this year is my laptop -

Overheats when things get intense

Ignores me when I need it the most

Shuts down randomly without an explanation

Basically, it's toxic, unpredictable, and emotionally unavailable… but hey, at least it won’t leave me for someone richer!

We were fighting incest jokes.

This is a reflection of a mindset. A mindset that normalizes rape jokes. A mindset that hides behind anonymity to spew hatred. A mindset that laughs while dehumanizing women.

If you hate the question asked by Ranveer, how can you be okay with this?

There's a difference between criticism and hate.

You can criticise people for their actions.

If you don’t like someone’s opinion, say why. If you think they’re wrong, explain how. But resorting to violence, abuse, and threats? That’s not criticism. That’s harassment.
